--- title: "input & output in Python" author: "Tony Duan" execute: warning: false error: false format: html: toc: true toc-location: right code-fold: show code-tools: true number-sections: true code-block-bg: true code-block-border-left: "#31BAE9" --- Data input and ouput in python ![](images/1_-OQi5hp-uoL_KdIydr4hew.gif){width="500"} # input ## read CSV ::: {#4a61732a .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd data=pd.read_csv('data/Book3.csv') data ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ```{=html}
a b
0 1241 rhth
1 35235 rjyyj
``` ::: ::: read CSV online ::: {#4227da42 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd url='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2020/2020-02-11/hotels.csv' hotels=pd.read_csv(url) ``` ::: ## read excel sheet_name=0 read first sheet. sheet_name=1 read second sheet. .sheet_name='Sheet1' read 'Sheet1' sheet. ::: {#66ddab63 .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd data_excel=pd.read_excel('data/Book1.xlsx',sheet_name=0) data_excel ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ```{=html}
a b
0 1241 rhth
1 35235 rjyyj
``` ::: ::: ## read parquet parquet format is one of the best for data analytic ::: {#b46da09f .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} data= pd.read_parquet("data/df.parquet") data.shape ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ``` (100, 62) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#d9afdd05 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} data.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: read parquet zip ::: {#f3494645 .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} data= pd.read_parquet("data/df.parquet.gzip") data.shape ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=5} ``` (100, 62) ``` ::: ::: ## read feather ::: {#7f0bd01e .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} data=pd.read_feather("data/feather_file.feather") data.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: # outout ## write CSV ::: {#1d081f5e .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} data.head().to_csv('data/out.csv', index=False) ``` ::: ## write excel ::: {#fca45bad .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} data_excel.to_excel('data/out.xlsx') ``` ::: ## write parquet ::: {#21629acd .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.python .cell-code} data.head(100).to_parquet('data/df.parquet') ``` ::: output to zip format ::: {#f67cd7b3 .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.python .cell-code} data.head(100).to_parquet('data/df.parquet.gzip', compression='gzip') ``` ::: ## write feather ::: {#9c6c41d5 .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} data.head(100).to_feather("data/feather_file.feather") ``` ::: # Refernce https://medium.com/@gadhvirushiraj/the-best-file-format-for-data-science-ed756f937be8
